title: 2012-12-07 - Nov 2012 - Backdoor.W32.Makadocs Sample
plain_text:
# Nov 2012 - Backdoor.W32.Makadocs Sample

**[contagiodump.blogspot.com/2012/12/nov-2012-backdoorw32makadocs-sample.html](http://contagiodump.blogspot.com/2012/12/nov-2012-backdoorw32makadocs-sample.html)**

End of the year presents:

These is a sample of W32.Makadocs

Related News and Analysis:

November 2012

[Malware Targeting Windows 8 Uses Google Docs | Symantec](http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/malware-targeting-windows-8-uses-google-docs)

[Backdoor.Makadocs | Symantec](http://www.symantec.com/security_response/writeup.jsp?docid=2012-111609-4148-99)

**Download**

[Download. (Email me if you need the password scheme - see profile for email) -< fixed link](http://www.mediafire.com/?9dxdxqn371mnfj1)

[Download pcap](http://www.mediafire.com/?akprk8ygkpt8y7z)

**Files**

File: macadocs.exe_

MD5: 546fa31bb7a4164ca25c8667d4352338

Size: 151552

Symantec:


-----

When the Trojan is executed, it creates the following mutex so that only one instance of it
runs on the compromised computer:
Next, it connects to Google docs and uses it as a proxy in order to receive commands from
command-and-control (C&C) servers

**Additional details**

The file sends control codes directly to certain device drivers making use of
the [DeviceIoControl Windows API function.](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363216(v=vs.85).aspxhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363216(v=vs.85).aspx)
The file installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would
install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These
events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same
desktop as the calling thread. This is done making use of
the [SetWindowsHook Windows API function.](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms644990(v=vs.85).aspx)
